byline.contributor: Agustin Armendariz and Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting.
byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and RACHEL SHOREY

abstract: Filings with Federal Election Commission by Donald J Trump's presidential campaign reveal it began June with only $1.3 million cash on hand, paltry sum for general election candidate; Trump trails his opponent Hillary Clinton by over $41 million, has staff of 70 compared to her staff of almost 700, and his campaign has not run any television advertisements since he locked up nomination.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump began June with $1.3 million in campaign cash, trailing Hillary Clinton by more than $41 million, the biggest disadvantage for a major party’s nominee in recent history.

headline.main: Donald Trump Starts Summer Push With Crippling Money Deficit
headline.print_headline: Trump Campaign Is in Deep Hole on Fund-Raising

snippet: Mr. Trump began June with $1.3 million in campaign cash, trailing Hillary Clinton by more than $41 million, the biggest disadvantage for a major party’s nominee in recent history.
